discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
According to AWS's reliability pillar. You would want to test for failures as well as try to auto remediate issues with triggers. https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/framework/rel-failmgmt.html#:~:text=For%20example%2C%20when%20a%20particular%20metric%20crosses%20a%20threshold%2C%20you%20can%20trigger%20an%20automated%20action%20to%20remedy%20the%20problem

Selected Answer: AC
A. Test recovery procedures.
C. Handle software failures automatically.

Selected Answer: AC
A. Test recovery procedures: Testing recovery procedures will help identify potential issues and ensure that the application can recover quickly in the event of a failure. This will help reduce downtime and increase the reliability of the application.

C. Handle software failures automatically: Automating the handling of software failures, such as through the use of automated recovery processes or load balancers, can help ensure that the application continues to run smoothly even during times of high traffic. This can also help reduce the risk of human error, leading to increased reliability.

Selected Answer: AC
AC as per the reliability pillar

questions.question_text:
A company runs an application in the AWS Cloud. The levels of traffic to the application vary throughout the week. The company wants to increase the reliability of its application at all times, even during times of high traffic.

Which combination of steps will meet this requirement? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Make all changes in the environment manually.
choices.B: Purchase instances weekly based on the previous week's high traffic points.

questions.question_text:
A company needs to reserve a certain amount of Amazon EC2 compute resources in a specific Availability Zone within an AWS Region.

Which purchasing option should the company use to meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Zonal Reserved Instances

Selected Answer: D
The purchasing option that the company should use to reserve a certain amount of Amazon EC2 compute resources in a specific Availability Zone within an AWS Region is D. Zonal Reserved Instances.

Selected Answer: D
Zonal: When you purchase a Reserved Instance for a specific Availability Zone, it's referred to as a zonal Reserved Instance.

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/reserved-instances-scope.html

Answer D : https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/reserved-instances-scope.html


 Regional: When you purchase a Reserved Instance for a Region, it's referred to as a regional Reserved Instance.

 Zonal: When you purchase a Reserved Instance for a specific Availability Zone, it's referred to as a zonal Reserved Instance.

Selected Answer: D
Zonal Reserved Instances provide a discounted hourly rate for instances that are launched in a specific Availability Zone within an AWS Region. This purchasing option allows you to reserve capacity in a specific zone to meet your capacity needs and ensures that you can launch instances in that zone as needed.

Selected Answer: D
When you purchase a Reserved Instance, you determine the scope of the Reserved Instance. The scope is either regional or zonal.

Regional: When you purchase a Reserved Instance for a Region, it's referred to as a regional Reserved Instance.

Zonal: When you purchase a Reserved Instance for a specific Availability Zone, it's referred to as a zonal Reserved Instance.

Selected Answer: D
Possibly D
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/reserved-instances-scope.html

Selected Answer: D
keyword was a "specific Availability Zone" within a region. This is a Zonal reserved instance.

questions.question_text: Which AWS database service provides in-memory data storage?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Amazon ElastiCache
" Amazon ElastiCache improves the performance of web applications by allowing you to retrieve information from a fast, managed, in-memory system, instead of relying entirely on slower disk-based databases. The service simplifies and offloads the management, monitoring and operation of in-memory environments, enabling your engineering resources to focus on developing applications. "
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticache/faqs/

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Right sizing is the process of matching instance types and sizes to your workload performance and capacity requirements at the lowest possible cost.
 
Ref link: https://aws.amazon.com/aws-cost-management/aws-cost-optimization/right-sizing/#:~:text=Right%20sizing%20is%20the%20process,at%20the%20lowest%20possible%20cost.

Selected Answer: B
B. Rightsizing

questions.question_text:
A company is running a workload in the AWS Cloud.

Which AWS best practice ensures the MOST cost-effective architecture for the workload?
Which AWS service gives users the ability to build interactive business intelligence dashboards that include machine learning insights?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A. Amazon Athena - query service for RDS or S3
B. Amazon Kendra - Enterprise search engine w/ ML
C. Amazon QuickSight - https://aws.amazon.com/quicksight/resources/faqs/#:~:text=Amazon%20QuickSight%20is%20a%20very,%2C%20anytime%2C%20on%20any%20device.
D. Amazon Redshift - CloudData Warehousing

Selected Answer: C
C. Amazon QuickSight

Selected Answer: C
Amazon QuickSight is a cloud-based business intelligence service that allows users to build visualizations, perform ad-hoc analysis, and create interactive dashboards. It includes built-in machine learning capabilities that allow users to gain insights and make predictions based on their data. QuickSight can connect to various data sources, including Amazon Redshift, Amazon RDS, and Amazon S3, among others.

Selected Answer: C
QuickSight

Selected Answer: C
Amazon QuickSight is a very fast, easy-to-use, cloud-powered business analytics service that makes it easy for all employees within an organization to build visualizations, perform ad-hoc analysis, and quickly get business insights from their data, anytime, on any device.
 
Amazon QuickSight is a cloud-scale business intelligence (BI) service that you can use to deliver easy-to-understand insights to the people who you work with, wherever they are. Amazon QuickSight connects to your data in the cloud and combines data from many different sources. In a single data dashboard, QuickSight can include AWS data, third-party data, big data, spreadsheet data, SaaS data, B2B data, and more.
 
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/quicksight/latest/user/welcome.html
